author: jeffrey.downard
title: Network of policy advocates
description: Como desenvolver uma rede de defensores para promover políticas sensatas de bloqueio?

f6_assessments.q0: A network of expertise will eventually be needed to carry the legal load of these novel technologies. However, it might be wise to focus on the future, being universities to train people and make them knowledgeable about cryptographic law. Educational resources are a good start to recruit already established legal personnel.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility of this proposal is dependent on how it would get known in the legal sphere. So a marketing strategy would prove beneficial. In the proposal there is only a social media campaign present. You'd need to hit the campuses in order to reach undergraduates.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap, initial plan, funding breakdown and team details in place. In the comments it became apparent that this proposal is a placeholder. The definitive version will be published in a next fund. KPI still needs to be determined.

f6_assessments.q0: Developing online educational resources to empower a network of engaged lawyers and law students to promote wise blockchain policy - great idea, very relevant in time and is very well aligned with the challenge intention! This kind of initiative can have a strong (positive) impact to the Cardano community and blockchain community in general. Great lobbying for favorable legislation assumes clarity and this is what the proposal brings on the table.
f6_assessments.q1: Convincing team, very clear step-by-step plan, clear idea and value proposition and a good break-down of the budget. Based on this information, it is quite likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the project has clear milestones and "deliverables", it possible to audit the progress and the eventual success as well. However, current assessment is 4 of 5 since quantifiable and measurable KPI-s are not sufficiently presented.

f6_assessments.q0: As the aim of the proposal is to engage the legal community in the Catalyst process, this proposal fits into the challenge settings. If successful it will urge the legal community to enact favorable laws for Cardano and other blockchains.
f6_assessments.q1:
From the relevant experience section, I believe that the team possess the skills and experience to implement the proposal considering the fact that there is a legal advocate, expert from business law and other experts. The budget is well presented.
The proposer has not included possible risks involved in the implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has outlined the roadmap, milestones and time horizon for the achievement of the proposal. Metrics that define the success of the proposal are narrowly stated.

f6_assessments.q0: Great initiative. I really get the idea very well. The solution here is effective for the challenge. Educating and creating a network of advocates and students of law to promote wise blockchain policy. I think the best way to arm advocacy is through education. My only concern is whether the team has a particular state to focus on or the plan is the create a network of advocates globally. I think this can be a global resource center to educate individuals on blockchain advocacy.
f6_assessments.q1: Excellent team experience. I think the team is capable of executing the proposal successfully. The proposal gave little details as to how success would mean. In all, the plan is great, practical, and achievable. I think this proposal should be given the needed support.
f6_assessments.q2: Great budget breakdown. I believe the team is transparent and open to auditing. The team plans to have a Youtube channel and report on activities as well. This is great for easy tracking.

f6_assessments.q0: It's a good idea to build a community like that but the impact is unsure. Because that community can have people that will help to have favorable legislation in the future but it's not an immediate impact that we can see from the plan. Though it's good to have a community like that, I think we can focus to invest in something have impact in the near future first.
f6_assessments.q1: They can held activities as plan because they are on the field (they might have relationships with college students or law schollars...). However the result of these activities is unsure (Will the participants find it promising to join the community? Will the community can actively do something to change the legislation?) They do not mention "the selling point" of their activities. However, the plan is clear with timeline and phases.
f6_assessments.q2: They can give evidents of their action, we can easily know if they are successfully build a big community. However it might take a long time for us to see that community contribution. However it would be better if they include detail KPIs in their proposal.

solution: Desenvolver recursos educacionais on-line para capacitar uma rede de advogados e estudantes de direito engajados a promover uma sábia política de bloqueio.
experience: Consultoria em direito, educação e assessoria jurídica, consultoria em sistemas empresariais
